alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 20 at 4:26AM AKDT until March 20 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT THIS MORNING FOR THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST AND NUNIVAK ISLAND... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. Visibilities reduced to one quarter mile or lower at times. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta coast and Nunivak Island. * WHEN...Until 10 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Areas of blowing snow to significantly reduce visibility down to one quarter mile. Power outages due to strong winds are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The lowest visibilities are currently ongoing along the coast. However, blowing snow may spread as far inland as Bethel as snow pushes from west to east through the morning hours today. By late morning, the front exits east and steady snowfall will transition to snow showers. In combination with warming temperatures, this will lead to an end to blizzard conditions by midday.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.
